byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and Michael M. Grynbaum from New York.
byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio clashes with Gov Andrew M Cuomo over city housing proposal; differing positions on tax break program known as 421-a is new round in their rivalry.
lead_paragraph: In the latest chapter of New York’s most passive-aggressive political relationship, Mayor Bill de Blasio and Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo are clashing, yet again, over a housing proposal.

headline.main: New Round in a Rivalry for de Blasio and Cuomo
headline.print_headline: New Round in a Rivalry for de Blasio and Cuomo

snippet: In the latest chapter of New York’s most passive-aggressive political relationship, Mayor Bill de Blasio and Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo are clashing, yet again, over a housing proposal.
